archetype_name: Family Skillet Curries & Stir-Fries (Medium Heat, 15–30, Intermediate)
name: Black Pepper Tofu & Bok Choy Stir-Fry with Microwave Rice
description: Crispy cornflour-coated tofu tossed with bok choy, onions, and bell pepper in Thai black pepper sauce. Medium-heat family stir-fry served over quick microwave rice.
prep_steps: Drain tofu and pat very dry; cut into 2 cm cubes.
Toss tofu with cornflour in a bowl to lightly coat.
Trim bok choy; separate stems and leaves, slice stems and roughly chop leaves.
Slice onions; mince garlic; slice bell pepper into strips.
Thinly slice spring onion for garnish.
Microwave rice pouches per pack timing just before serving (keep sealed until step 6).
cook_steps: Heat canola oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
Add coated tofu in a single layer; cook 6–8 minutes, turning to crisp all sides. Transfer tofu to a plate.
In the same pan, add a little more canola oil if dry. Stir-fry onions and bell pepper 2 minutes.
Add bok choy stems and garlic; stir-fry 1–2 minutes until fragrant.
Return tofu to the pan. Add Thai black pepper sauce, tamari, and chili flakes; toss 1–2 minutes until glazed. Fold in bok choy leaves to wilt, 30–60 seconds.
Microwave rice pouches, fluff, and divide among bowls. Top with stir-fry and spring onion. Serve immediately.
